intro: Pedicularis sarawschanica, commonly known as the Sarawak lousewort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
